title: Manchester United news: Paul Pogba has 'a cracked toe'
text:
Paul Pogba's mystery foot injury has finally been diagnosed as a 'cracked toe', according to reports in France.

But it is not thought that the Manchester United star will need surgery to solve the issue as he battles to be fit to face Liverpool on October 20.

The club and player are preferring to go down the 'natural' route of recovery, according to L'Equipe.

Paul Pogba's mystery foot injury has finally been diagnosed as a 'cracked toe'

Pogba took a knock in the Carabao Cup penalty shootout over Rochdale last month where a scan revealed a 'microfisure'.

He then played in last week's draw against Arsenal, where the pain in his foot worsened.

Recovery time could take two to three weeks, making him a doubt for the clash with Jurgen Klopp's men at Old Trafford next weekend.

Manchester United's Paul Pogba is currently in Dubai trying to recover from his injured foot

The French midfielder has been working in the soaring temperatures in Dubai

Pogba recently arrived in the United Arab Emirates to complete a warm-weather recovery programme to accelerate his return, as revealed by Sportsmail earlier this week.

The Manchester United midfielder is using the state-of-the-art Transform Altitude Performance Center as his base for his rehabilitation work in Dubai.

Pogba landed on Sunday and was expected to stay for the majority of the week ahead of returning to United’s Carrington HQ.
description: Paul Pogba's mystery foot injury has finally been diagnosed as a 'cracked toe', according to reports in France. But it is not thought that he will need surgery to rectify the issue.
